Package game.controller

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.controller.GameController
  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The overall controller of a Monopoly game. It provides access to all basic actions and activities for the game. All other activities of the game, should be implemented by referring to the basic actions and activities in this class.

    Note that this controller is far from being finished and many things could be done in a much nicer and cleaner way! But, it shows the general idea of how the model, view (GUI), and the controller could work with each other, and how different parts of the game's activities can be separated from each other, so that different parts can be added and extended independently from each other.

    For fully implementing the game, it will probably be necessary to add more of these basic actions in this class.

    The doAction() methods of the Space and the Card can be implemented on the basic actions and activities of this game controller. based

    Author:
    Ekkart Kindler, ekki@dtu.dk, Malte B. Kristensen, s185039@student.dtu.dk, Nicolai d T. Wulff, s185036@student.dtu.dk, Neal P. Norman, s060527@student.dtu.dk, Jeppe K. Larsen, s170196@student.dtu.dk, Mads M. D. Hemer, s170185@student.dtu.dk, Nicolai J. Larsen, s185020@student.dtu.dk

      • GameController

        public GameController()
        Constructor for a controller of a game. TODO: There is a call to super();, but GameController has no superclass, so this call is pointless. also consider standardising the constructor. Stick to one convention create object in constructor: private JSONUtility ju = new JSONUtility(); > constructor

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGUI

        public void initializeGUI()
        TODO: This method should be moved to the View class, possibly as a part of the existing initializeGUI-method in that class. This method will initialize the GUI by adding descriptions to all properties. As of now, the initialization assumes that the spaces of the game fit to the fields of the GUI; this could eventually be changed, by creating the GUI fields based on the underlying game's spaces (fields).

      • playOrLoadGame

        public void playOrLoadGame()
        This method calls the GUI to show the first dialogue with the user. Shows a menu, where the user can choose to either start a new game, load a game, or exit the application. The method recurses infinitly, so that the menu is automatically shown when a game is ended og exited.

      • play

        public void play()
        The main method to start the game. The game is started with the current player of the game; this makes it possible to resume a game at any point.

      • showTurnMenu

        public void showTurnMenu​(Player player)
        Show the basic turn menu to player. Menu consists of: bygge, sÃ¦lge, handle and pantsÃ¦tte, save game and close game. Shows a menu with different buttons for each function of the game, which is: Build houses/hotels, trade, sell houses, mortgage/unmortage, save game, close game, and "drive" (as in throw the dice and move the token). Each player (in real life) may use these options whenever they wish.
        Parameters:
        player - the player passed in to take turn.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame()
        Saves the current game to the database

      • gameEnds

        public boolean gameEnds()
        Checks if one or less players are broke
        Returns:
        boolean This returns true when the game is over.

      • winner

        public boolean winner()
        Checks whether there is a player that isn't broke. displays message with specific message when activated.
        Returns:
        boolean, This returns true when there is a winner

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove​(Player player)
              throws PlayerBrokeException,
                     GameEndedException
        This method implements a activity of a single move of the given player. It throws a PlayerBrokeException if the player goes broke in this move. Takes into account actions required if player is in prison. Rolls the dice
        Parameters:
        player - the player making the move
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - if the player goes broke during the move
        GameEndedException

      • moveToSpace

        public void moveToSpace​(Player player,
                        Space space)
                 throws PlayerBrokeException,
                        GameEndedException
        This method implements the activity of moving the player to the new position, including all actions associated with moving the player to the new position.
        Parameters:
        player - the moved player
        space - the space to which the player moves
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the player goes broke doing the action on that space
        GameEndedException - if the game ends

        Parameters:

      • returnChanceCardToDeck

        public void returnChanceCardToDeck​(Card card)
        This method implements the action returning a drawn card or a card keep with the player for some time back to the bottom of the card deck.
        Parameters:
        card - returned card

      • obtainCash

        public boolean obtainCash​(Player player,
                          int amount,
                          boolean beforePurchase)
        This method implements the activity where a player can obtain cash by selling houses back to the bank, by mortgaging own properties, or by selling properties to other players. This method is called, whenever the player does not have enough cash available for an action. If the player does not manage to free at least the given amount of money, the player will be broke; this is to help the player make the right choices for freeing enough money.
        Parameters:
        player - the player
        amount - the amount the player should have available after the act
        beforePurchase - when set to true, this method handles the situation, where a player wants to try to obtain cash before purchasing a property. When false, handles the situation where a player is about to go broke.

      • offerToBuy

        public void offerToBuy​(Property property,
                       Player player)
                throws PlayerBrokeException,
                       GameEndedException
        This method implements the activity of offering a player to buy a property. This is typically triggered by a player arriving on an property that is not sold yet. If the player chooses not to buy, the property will be set for auction.
        Parameters:
        property - the property to be sold
        player - the player the property is offered to
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the player chooses to buy but could not afford it
        GameEndedException

      • payment

        public void payment​(Player payer,
                    int amount,
                    Player receiver)
             throws PlayerBrokeException,
                    GameEndedException
        This method implements a payment activity to another player, which involves the player to obtain some cash on the way, in case he does not have enough cash available to pay right away. If he cannot free enough money in the process, the player will go bankrupt.
        Parameters:
        payer - the player making the payment
        amount - the payed amount
        receiver - the beneficiary of the payment
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the payer goes broke by this payment
        GameEndedException

      • paymentFromBank

        public void paymentFromBank​(Player player,
                            int amount)
        This method implements the action of a player receiving money from the bank.
        Parameters:
        player - the player receiving the money
        amount - the amount recieved from the bank

      • paymentToBank

        public void paymentToBank​(Player player,
                          int amount)
                   throws PlayerBrokeException,
                          GameEndedException
        This method implements the activity of a player making a payment to the bank. Note that this might involve the player to obtain some cash; in case he cannot free enough cash, he will go bankrupt to the bank.
        Parameters:
        player - the player making the payment
        amount - the amount
        Throws:
        PlayerBrokeException - when the player goes broke by the payment
        GameEndedException

      • playerBrokeTo

        Action handling the situation when one player is broke to another player. All money and properties are transferred to the other player.
        Parameters:
        brokePlayer - the broke player
        benificiary - the player who receives the money and assets

      • displaySortedInfo

        public void displaySortedInfo()
        This method is yet to be finished or utilized in the code. The method could be further developed into a feature, where the user could choose to display various sorted information about the state of the game somewhere in the GUI, eg: 1. How the players rank according to their total assets. 2. How all properties rank according to their current rent. 3. Or something else. Different comparators should be defined in this method. This method uses the quickSort-method (see above), which is passed a collection and a comparator, and then returns a sorted arrayList.
